description: The AI Agent Tooling subsystem, encapsulated within the `agents.tools` package, provides a controlled and structured interface for AI agents to interact with the codebase and its static analysis results, abstracting direct file system or complex analysis data access. The internal relationships within this subsystem are primarily hierarchical and delegation-based. The `Codebase Toolkit` acts as a composite tool, serving as the primary interface for external AI agents. It delegates specific, fine-grained tasks to the other specialized tools (File Reader Tool, CFG Retrieval Tool, File Structure Tool, Code Reference Reader). This design promotes modularity, allowing each specialized tool to focus on a single responsibility while the `Codebase Toolkit` provides a cohesive and simplified API for agents.

components.name: Codebase Toolkit
components.description: This component acts as the central orchestrator and facade for all CodeBoarding analysis and information retrieval tools. It provides a unified interface for AI agents to access various code-related functionalities, simplifying agent interaction with the underlying tooling.

components.name: File Reader Tool
components.description: This component offers a fundamental capability to read and retrieve specific content or lines from any file within the repository. It serves as the basic interface for agents to access raw file content.

components.name: CFG Retrieval Tool
components.description: This component specializes in extracting and providing Control Flow Graph (CFG) data for specified code components. It enables agents to understand the execution flow within functions and methods.

components.name: File Structure Tool
components.description: This component provides a structured view of the project's file and directory hierarchy. It allows agents to navigate and understand the overall organization of the codebase.

components.name: Code Reference Reader
components.description: This component retrieves the source code for specific classes, functions, or methods given their fully qualified names. It allows agents to inspect the implementation details of specific code entities.
